name: Lima Beans (Butter Beans)
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 3 servings of legumes daily
Large, flat, pale green or white beans with buttery texture
Also known as butter beans due to their creamy consistency
Excellent source of plant-based protein, fiber, and molybdenum
Benefits excess body weight and insulin resistance
Rich in manganese, folate, and resistant starch
Particularly high in soluble fiber for cholesterol reduction
benefits: Lima beans provide exceptional nutrition with high fiber (13g per cooked cup) and protein that promote satiety and weight loss. They benefit excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress. Their abundant soluble fiber specifically helps lower LDL cholesterol while their resistant starch feeds beneficial gut bacteria and improves insulin sensitivity, making them essential for the Daily Dozen's three daily servings of legumes.
amount: Part of 3 daily servings of legumes (Daily Dozen). 1 serving = 1/2 cup cooked lima beans

quotes: Legumes – beans, chickpeas, split peas, and lentils – are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fibre and antioxidants. In terms of nutrition density, they may give the biggest bang for the buck, benefitting excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress.
